sentence.Network_en: The title is per-haps an allusion to AIDS.
sentence.Network_cn: 该题目可能暗指艾滋病。

sentence.Network_en: His statement was seen as an allusion to the recent drug-related killings.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的声明被视为暗指最近与毒品有关的多起凶杀案。

sentence.Network_en: He made an allusion to a secret plan in his speech.
sentence.Network_cn: 在讲话中他暗示有一项秘密计划.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (denoting a pun, metaphor, or parable): from French, or from late Latin allusio(n-), from the verb alludere (see allude)

entry.tran: 间接提到；暗指；影射；典故
entry.def: An allusion is an indirect reference to someone or something.

example.ex: The title is perhaps an allusion to AIDS.
example.tran: 该题目可能暗指艾滋病。
